title: 112_hr2860
content: The Act titled "Deficit Committee Transparency Act" requires disclosure of activities by members and staff of the Joint Select Committee on Deficit Reduction. The Budget Control Act of 2011 is amended to require disclosure of lobbying activities and meetings by members and staff of the Joint Select Committee on Deficit Reduction. The Budget Control Act of 2011 is amended to mandate disclosure of lobbying activities and meetings by members and staff of the Joint Select Committee on Deficit Reduction, including disclosure of campaign contributions. Meetings must be disclosed within 48 hours. The Budget Control Act of 2011 now requires disclosure of contributions received by committees or leadership PACs from registered lobbyists, foreign principals, or entities influencing legislative proposals. Disclosure must occur within 48 hours. The Budget Control Act of 2011 mandates disclosure of contributions from registered lobbyists, foreign principals, or entities influencing legislative proposals within 48 hours of receipt. Definitions for terms like 'authorized committee', 'candidate', and 'contribution' are provided in the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. The Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971 requires a final report on activities and campaign contributions to be submitted to Congress by December 2, 2011. Meetings preceding certain votes must be posted on the joint committee's website within 48 hours. The joint committee must establish a public website before its first meeting, containing required information and additional details deemed necessary for informing the public about the committee's proceedings and deadlines. The joint committee must post required information on its website within specified timeframes. SEC. 3. The joint committee must make the proposed report and legislative language available to the public on its website at least 72 hours before the vote. SEC. 4. Joint committee hearings must have audio and visual coverage. SEC. 4. Audio and visual coverage of joint committee hearings is required, including streaming on the Internet via the committee's website.
